name: Near and Far - Single
description: Single greeting card. A pair of new greeting cards featuring two postcard collages, which were exhibited as part of an installation of 464 postcard collages, All breathing in heaven (Geelong Regional Gallery, 2013). 1. Wet whiskers drying. X5 (Batesford Bridge, Geelong.) As featured recently on the cover of Art Almanac. 2. Keeping in line. X5 (Rock City, Tennessee.) A full-colour print, folded blank card on a smooth, heavy-weight matte stock with a matching self-adhesive envelope. Each card comes wrapped in a clear plastic sleeve. Card size 158mm X 110mm. Blank interior. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Stage card - Three pack
description: A set of three stage cards, one of each kind. 1. Stage card - owl X1 2. Stage card - bear X1 3. Stage card - dancing bear X1 A full-colour print, folded blank card on a smooth, heavy-weight matte stock with a matching self-adhesive envelope. Also included is a separate full-colour print card with collage element/puppet pieces and instructions. Each card comes wrapped in a clear plastic sleeve. Please note, card writers: all our plastic sleeves are recyclable. Card size 158mm X 110mm. Blank interior. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Stage card - dancing bear
description: Single greeting card with a dancing bear puppet for you to make. Release your dancing bear puppet with a pair of scissors (or blade) and use the supplied pins to fasten him together. The audience awaits! A full-colour print, folded blank card on a smooth, heavy-weight matte stock with a matching self-adhesive envelope. Also included is a separate full-colour print card with bear parts, instructions, and three split gold pins. Each card comes wrapped in a clear plastic sleeve. Please note, card writers: all our plastic sleeves are recyclable. Card size 158mm X 110mm. Blank interior. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Stage card - bear
description: Single greeting card with a cut your own collage element. Release your animal with a pair of scissors by following the outline of animal and base. Cut along the dotted line on the front of the card with a blade. Voila! Your bear is now ready to step onto their stage. Fasten with sticky tape, from the inside, as required. The scene is set. The audience awaits. Lights! A full-colour print, folded blank card on a smooth, heavy-weight matte stock with a matching self-adhesive envelope. Also included is a separate full-colour print card with bear and instructions. Each card comes wrapped in a clear plastic sleeve. Please note, card writers: all our plastic sleeves are recyclable. Card size 158mm X 110mm. Blank interior. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Wraparound book - Nighttime Scenes
description: Hand-bound wraparound book. Choose between two different cover options, one with a celestial comet in the sky, and the other depicting a tiny city, replete with illuminated lovers. Together, both covers form the one scene. Cover made from a digital colour print of a recent collaborative collage of ours. Stitched inside with orange and red thread are six double-sided blank pages, using 280gsm drawing paper. Notebook size 120mm X 80mm. Blank pages, no lines. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: A7 Scribbler notebooks
description: hammer & daisy scribbler notebook. A7 in size with a fabric cover. Using 120 gsm quality white paper for the insides, they make for an ideal spot to jot your notes and daily lists. Notebook size 75mm X 105mm. Blank pages, no lines. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Bird pinnie by hammer & daisy - Clementine
description: ++ Previously $30.00 ++ Meet birdie chum, Clementine, a hammer & daisy bird shaped pinnie, seeking a loving home. She has a keen eye, and a penchant for serves of buttered leek and ice-cream (though never together in the one dish). She enjoys flying close to the sun and the company of others. Designed as a handy little pincushion, she could easily double as a stuffed toy companion. No two birds from this merry gathering are the same, this one has been lovingly stitched by hand with bright red beak markings, gold plumage, and cream wings. Belgian linen fabric front with a blue and white striped fabric on the reverse side. With a decorative button eye and a small hammer & daisy fabric tag on the underside. Nestle a pinnie in your palm or keep one in your pocket. Stuffed owl pincushion size 6cm X 15cm. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Thelma's Little Ladies - group one
description: Meet Thelma's little ladies, Augusta, Delphine and Benita. No two Thelma's little ladies are the same, and each has been lovingly stitched by hand and features a hand-painted face. As per their stuffie counterparts, Thelma's little ladies come in a variety of costumes and all sport excellent manners. They are a jackpot of admirable traits. (Didn't Grace Kelly say something similar to Cary Grant in To Catch a Thief?) Differences, quirks and individual particulars aside, all stuffed creatures and little ladies are made completely by hand with a full percentage of love by Elaine Haby (who masquerades, with her foot on the peddle of her sewing machine and a pin in her mouth, under the name Thelma for hammer & daisy). Little Ladies size 24cm X 14cm. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Thelma's Little Ladies - group two
description: Meet Thelma's little ladies, Audrey, Ina, Mae and Petunia. No two Thelma's little ladies are the same, and each has been lovingly stitched by hand and features a hand-painted face. As per their stuffie counterparts, Thelma's little ladies come in a variety of costumes and all sport excellent manners. They are a jackpot of admirable traits. (Didn't Grace Kelly say something similar to Cary Grant in To Catch a Thief?) Differences, quirks and individual particulars aside, all stuffed creatures and little ladies are made completely by hand with a full percentage of love by Elaine Haby (who masquerades, with her foot on the peddle of her sewing machine and a pin in her mouth, under the name Thelma for hammer & daisy). Little Ladies size 24cm X 14cm. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Artists' print - From this bed, with the wings of a bird...
description: From this bed, with the wings of a bird, I flew to the sea as I slept last night Gracia Haby, 2010. Five-colour lithographic offset print on Fabriano bright-white 300gsm paper. This work, especially made for my part of Of Birds and Fishes, is a printed collage piece called From this bed, with the wings of a bird, I flew to the sea as I slept last night. In this collage, there features owls, ducks and fish of all sizes. They swim and leap their way throughout the scene dictated by a theatre set by the painter Paul Nash. The set was created for a one-act play, The Truth About the Russian Dancers, written especially for the dancer Tamara Karsavina by J. M. Barrie. The play was first performed in 1920 at the London Colosseum. At the Savoy some six years later, the play was revived, and now it forms the backdrop to my dreams. All prints come wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth and flat print to your door. Paper size 30cm X 30cm. A limited edition of twenty. Printed by Redwood Prints. Of Birds and Fishes, 2010 {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Golden paper finches
description: Golden paper finches (double-sided and featuring a pencil drawing by Louise multiplied on the photocopier), hand-cut and ready to suspend in position of your choosing. A Charm of Finches Good as Gold exhibited as part of Hidden Gems and Rough Diamonds at Milly Sleeping (2012). Sold individually, from a charm of 100, each finch comes secured with a length of golden thread to enable easy suspension. Finch size 160mm X 70mm. Discover a little more here. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Artists' print - On the shore in a dither
description: On the shore, in a dither. Gracia Haby, 2011. Four-colour lithographic offset print on Fabriano bright-white hot-press 300gsm paper. In this series of eight postcard collages (2011) made into prints, you will meet a Buffalo in Vancouver's Stanley Park, an Asiatic Black Bear as you boat about in Cambridge, catch sight your twin in the rough seas of Hastings and a Wild Cat holding steady. You'd be advised to hold onto your hats, should one at present be atop your head. Dear you, If I could be sure the craft wouldnt leak, Id hop in on the double and set my oars in motion. But I aint sure, and so I linger. On the shore, in a dither. In the distance, Conway Castle. An undecided state is, in short, no pleasurable state. Yours in confusion of bother and profusion of knots, X All prints come wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth and flat print to your door. Paper size 16cm X 20cm. A limited edition of twenty-five. Printed by Redwood Prints. Eight postcard collage prints, 2011 {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Artists' print - Unseen fugitives
description: Unseen fugitives. Gracia Haby, 2011. Four-colour lithographic offset print on Fabriano bright-white hot-press 300gsm paper. In this series of eight postcard collages (2011) made into prints, you will meet a Buffalo in Vancouver's Stanley Park, an Asiatic Black Bear as you boat about in Cambridge, catch sight your twin in the rough seas of Hastings and a Wild Cat holding steady. You'd be advised to hold onto your hats, should one at present be atop your head. All prints come wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth and flat print to your door. Paper size 16cm X 20cm. A limited edition of twenty-five. Printed by Redwood Prints. Eight postcard collage prints, 2011 {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Artists' print - Holding steady
description: Holding steady. Gracia Haby, 2011. Four-colour lithographic offset print on Fabriano bright-white hot-press 300gsm paper. In this series of eight postcard collages (2011) made into prints, you will meet a Buffalo in Vancouver's Stanley Park, an Asiatic Black Bear as you boat about in Cambridge, catch sight your twin in the rough seas of Hastings and a Wild Cat holding steady. You'd be advised to hold onto your hats, should one at present be atop your head. The Wild Cat (Felis silvestris) in this particular work stalks most of its prey on the ground, catching small rodents and ground-dwelling birds. All prints come wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth and flat print to your door. Paper size 16cm X 20cm. A limited edition of twenty-five. Printed by Redwood Prints. Eight postcard collage prints, 2011 {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Artists' print - I thought I saw you there
description: I thought I saw you there. Gracia Haby, 2011. Four-colour lithographic offset print on Fabriano bright-white hot-press 300gsm paper. In this series of eight postcard collages (2011) made into prints, you will meet a Buffalo in Vancouver's Stanley Park, an Asiatic Black Bear as you boat about in Cambridge, catch sight your twin in the rough seas of Hastings and a Wild Cat holding steady. You'd be advised to hold onto your hats, should one at present be atop your head. Dear you, I thought I saw you there. In Hastings by the sea. Upon closer inspection, I see that I was wrong. It was a trick played upon me by my own eyes. Not you at all but a giant wave crashing against the ledge. Kisses from this lone and befuddled snowshoe hare, X All prints come wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth and flat print to your door. Paper size 16cm X 20cm. A limited edition of twenty-five. Printed by Redwood Prints. Eight postcard collage prints, 2011 {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Artists' print - With a certain sense of security...
description: With a certain sense of security, the swamp wallaby paused and took in his new surrounds. Gracia Haby, 2011. Four-colour lithographic offset print on Fabriano bright-white hot-press 300gsm paper. In this series of eight postcard collages (2011) made into prints, you will meet a Buffalo in Vancouver's Stanley Park, an Asiatic Black Bear as you boat about in Cambridge, catch sight your twin in the rough seas of Hastings and a Wild Cat holding steady. You'd be advised to hold onto your hats, should one at present be atop your head. The Swamp wallaby (Wallabia bicolor) in this particular work is known to break cover only when in danger and take off at high speed. All prints come wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth and flat print to your door. Paper size 16cm X 20cm. A limited edition of twenty-five. Printed by Redwood Prints. Eight postcard collage prints, 2011 {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Artists' print - No one but you and me
description: No one but you and me. Gracia Haby, 2011. Four-colour lithographic offset print on Fabriano bright-white hot-press 300gsm paper. In this series of eight postcard collages (2011) made into prints, you will meet a Buffalo in Vancouver's Stanley Park, an Asiatic Black Bear as you boat about in Cambridge, catch sight your twin in the rough seas of Hastings and a Wild Cat holding steady. You'd be advised to hold onto your hats, should one at present be atop your head. The American Manatee (Trichecus manatus) in this particular work feeds at night, foraging by touch and smell, aided by the three nails in each of its flippers. All prints come wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth and flat print to your door. Paper size 16cm X 20cm. A limited edition of twenty-five. Printed by Redwood Prints. Eight postcard collage prints, 2011 {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Artists' print - A fortunate leap
description: A fortunate leap. Gracia Haby, 2011. Four-colour lithographic offset print on Fabriano bright-white hot-press 300gsm paper. In this series of eight postcard collages (2011) made into prints, you will meet a Buffalo in Vancouver's Stanley Park, an Asiatic Black Bear as you boat about in Cambridge, catch sight your twin in the rough seas of Hastings and a Wild Cat holding steady. You'd be advised to hold onto your hats, should one at present be atop your head. Labelled as a Buffalo on original postcard, own further bovid research leads us to believe this is actually a American Bison (Bison bison). All prints come wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth and flat print to your door. Paper size 16cm X 20cm. A limited edition of twenty-five. Printed by Redwood Prints. Eight postcard collage prints, 2011 {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Artists' print - All became clear by moonlight
description: All became clear by moonlight. Gracia Haby, 2011. Four-colour lithographic offset print on Fabriano bright-white hot-press 300gsm paper. In this series of eight postcard collages (2011) made into prints, you will meet a Buffalo in Vancouver's Stanley Park, an Asiatic Black Bear as you boat about in Cambridge, catch sight your twin in the rough seas of Hastings and a Wild Cat holding steady. You'd be advised to hold onto your hats, should one at present be atop your head. The Asiatic Black Bear (Ursus Americanus) in this particular work roams mostly at night in search of food such as fruit, berries, nuts, roots, and honey. They are ruled by their sense of smell. All prints come wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth and flat print to your door. Paper size 16cm X 20cm. A limited edition of twenty-five. Printed by Redwood Prints. Eight postcard collage prints, 2011 {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Publication - Thirteen Seasons (in one day)
description: Thirteen Seasons (in one day), a publication by Francesca Sasnaitis with drawings by Louise Jennison. A 10.5cm X 15cm, 24 page black and white publication. Published by Ratas Editions. Signed limited edition of 50. VII the ceaseless whir of cicadas the chirrup of blackbirds in the clinging heat of dusk XII beyond the Norfolk Island pines a tanker splits the iron-grey sea and sky in two Publication comes wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure smooth arrival to your door. Publication proportions: 10.5cm X 15cm. Discover a little more here. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Artists' print - Tiny as a soul there comes the rabbit
description: Tiny as a soul, there comes the rabbit. Gracia Haby and Louise Jennison, 2010. Four-colour lithographic offset print on Fabriano bright-white 300gsm hot-press paper. For our part in the exhibition Playing Field (Craft Victoria, 2010), we made four prints especially related to the theme of Childhood. Tiny as a soul, there comes the rabbit is one of this loose suite of four. There is a tiny white rabbit seated at a table surrounded by three foxes eager to know him better (in our print Tiny as a soul, there comes the rabbit), and there is a girl riding an ostrich through Venice (in our print Moving forward in the way of all things). There are French-speaking animals and characters from the Ballet Russes (in our print We recognise this scene set with its moon above and stars left on) and new cities fantastical that resemble both Cairo and Brittany entwined together (in our print There are cities one will not see again). It is fun to dream up these scenarios, to make anything possible, to move our characters about on a giant paper stage. All prints come wrapped with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth and flat print to your door. Paper size 30cm X 30cm. A limited edition of fifteen. Printed by Redwood Prints. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Artists' print - They had returned
description: They had returned. Gracia Haby, 2010. Four-colour lithographic offset print on Fabriano bright-white hot-press 300gsm paper. This print features a recent postcard collage exhibited at Craft Victoria late 2009, as part of our exhibition A key to help make your own world visible, and featured in the recent zine of same name. In this series of postcard collages made into prints (there are 8 in total), you will find the geography dotted with the familiar, and many animals and birds. These tailed or winged protagonists often appear out of place, oft too large for their present surrounds. They climb across the rocks illuminated by moonlight. Sometimes they leap at the moon. Sometimes they saunter nonchalantly through a city as they look for a way in. Sometimes they tiptoe or creep, looking for a safe place to curl. Perhaps they pass undetected, slinking through the forest unseen. All prints come wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth and flat print to your door. Paper size 16cm X 20cm. A limited edition of fifteen. Printed by Redwood Prints. A suite of prints, 2010 {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Artists' print - Owl
description: ++ Previously $50.00 ++ Owl Louise Jennison, 2010. Based on a watercolour exhibited as part of A key to help make your own world visible, this new print features a drawing of an owl made originally of gold, enamel and agate, and sporting an emerald necklace. The original owl, from which this is drawn, was created by Gottfried Dring in 1718. It is one of many museum treasures of splendor and marvel from das Grne Gewlbe (the Green Vault), Dresden. A single-colour lithographic offset print on Lana Aquarelle Satin hot pressed 300gsm paper. (more) All prints come wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth and flat print to your door. Paper size 21cm X 30cm. An edition of twenty-five. Printed by Redwood Prints. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

Cover, watercolour, pencil and ink stamp on Fabriano Artistico HP 640gsm. 7cm X 10cm ten page concertina, bound by the artists. Printed by Redwood Prints. Edition of 12, 2008. name: Zine - 38.1500 S, 144.3500E
description: 38.1500 S, 144.3500E, a zine by Louise Jennison. A 21cm X 30cm (folded to 7.5cm X 10.5cm in proportion), B&W zine on lavender paper. This zine features pencil drawings of a Hooded Plover (Thinornis rubricollis); a Sacred Kingfisher (Todiramphus sanctus); a White-plumed Honeyeater (Lichenostomus penicillatus); and a Willie Wagtail (Rhipidura leucophrys). All zines are wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth zine to your door. Zine proportions: 10.5cm X 7.5cm. Discover a little more here. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Zine - A Postcard as Measuring Device
description: A Postcard as Measuring Device, a zine by Gracia Haby. A 10.5cm X 15cm, 23 double-sided page B&W zine with colour covers and stripy spine. Dear you, In 2008, an occasional series developed of own accord. A series of imagined tales written on the reverse side of a handful of my postcard collages. A collage front and back! Over the years, this has grown. Published online, and later bound into zine format, this project continues today, and rests now in your very palm. Twenty more Dear You postcard travels await you in this volume. Travel well, and mind the sink holes, Gracia Haby All zines are wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth zine to your door. Zine proportions: 10.5cm X 15cm. Discover a little more here. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Zine - A Catalogue of Bodies
description: A Catalogue of Bodies, a zine by Gracia Haby. A 10.5cm X 15cm, 77 double-sided page B&W zine with colour covers and blood red spine. A Catalogue of Bodies harvested from the television adaptations (1989-2014) of Agatha Christies stories featuring Hercule Poirot as played by David Suchet. Included in this grisly catalogue, pretend deaths (such as Magdala Nick Buckleys staged overdose in Peril at End House and Norma Restaricks staged suicide in the bathtub in The Third Girl, and what appears to be Arlena Stuarts strangled body on the beach but is actually Christine Redfern in disguise in Evil Under the Sun), suicides, deaths, and murders. In some cases, where the body is not shown, the moment just prior features, giving us Dorothy Craddock, having been earlier injected with bacteria, falling ill in Egypt in Cards on the Table; Rosaleen and Gordon Cloade just before the bomb blast in Taken at the Flood; Major Richard Knighton shown standing on the train tracks at mysterys culmination in The Blue Train; and because both were simply too good not to include, on a newspaper in Hastings hands, a headline announcing Felix Bleibners mysterious death in The Egyptian Tomb, and Lady Muriel in the play attended by Poirot and Arthur Hastings in The Third Floor Flat. Whilst several pretend deaths have been included, any thwarted attempts and near misses have been left out of the catalogue as they did not produce an actual body to document. For example, Nurse Hopkins thwarted attempt to poison Poirot (Sad Cypress), Mrs Rendells failed attempt to push Poirot before a train (Mrs McGintys Dead), Miss Phyllida Campion being pushed down the moving stairs (The Case of the Missing Will), and in order to throw suspicion onto others, Miss Gilchrists illness as a result of consuming a non-fatal, self-poisoned piece of wedding cake (After the Funeral). Deaths referred to in conversation only, such as Richard Abernethie from After the Funeral, have also not been included in this catalogue. A Catalogue of Bodies is ordered by original publication as opposed to televised adaptation. At time of printing the final five television adaptations that will conclude the series have not yet aired. Elephants Can Remember (1972), The Big Four (1927), The Labours of Hercules (1947), Dead Mans Folly (1956), and Curtain: Poirots Last Case (1975) will be added to the catalogue when they screen in Melbourne, Australia, and the zine will be re-released to include all titles that offer forth a body to record. All zines are wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth zine to your door. Zine proportions: 10.5cm X 15cm. Discover a little more here. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Zine - Genova
description: Genova to Johannesburg (Johannesburg to Genova), a zine by Gracia Haby. A 10.5cm X 15cm, 24 page full-colour and B&W zine with peppermint card covers and bright green spine. This zine includes seventeen pages reproduced from the artists book Before all colour faded (Ricordo di Genova) and seven pages reproduced from the artists book In search of a time the heart does not recall (Souvenir of Johannesburg) (2009). All zines are wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth zine to your door. Zine proportions: 10.5cm X 15cm. name: Bundle of three new zines
description: 1. The Glimmer of Armour, a zine by Gracia Haby, Louise Jennison & Hila Shachar. A 19cm X 14cm, 12 page full-colour zine, hand-stitched with golden thread. 2. Collection, a zine by Gracia Haby. A 19cm X 14cm, 12 page full-colour zine, hand-stitched with golden thread. 3. It's the Dusty Hour, a zine by Gracia Haby, Louise Jennison & Hila Shachar. A 19cm X 14cm, 12 page full-colour zine, hand-stitched with golden thread. The Glimmer of Armour, Collection, and It's the Dusty Hour can now be purchased as one handsome bundle. Each zine in this trio can also be purchased individually: The Glimmer of Armour, Collection, and It's the Dusty Hour. All zines are wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth zine to your door. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Zine - My dear, don't worry my deer
description: My dear, don't worry my deer, a zine by Gracia Haby. A 10.5cm X 15cm, 36 page full-colour and B&W zine (with postcard collages front and back, including typed Dear you narrative) with cream cover card and bullfinch pink spine, and a cardboard back. This zine includes eleven recent postcard collages from 2011. Dear you, I never knew I missed the smooth flat seas until they were a distant memory. Holding tight lest I slip off deck never to be sighted by those other than with scales and fishtail fans. Eyes closed, storm ahead, Wheres my sou'wester? X All zines are wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth zine to your door. Zine proportions: 10.5cm X 15cm. Discover a little more here. {Please note: price shown in Australian dollars.}

name: Zine - Just as the ship went down...
description: Just as the ship went down and other songs I don't believe I know, a zine by Gracia Haby. A 7cm X 30cm, six page colour concertina zine with a B&W text on paper wrap held in place by a red circle sticker. Edition of 75, 2011 Featuring six American Popular Song Sheet Covers, 18901922: Yes, I got it; When your cash and friends are gone; Fill the vacant chair; Just as the ship went down; They didn't believe me All zines are wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth zine to your door. name: Zine - Webbed

name: Zine - But I just got here a minute ago (I)
description: But I just got here a minute ago (vol I), a zine by Gracia Haby. A 10.5cm X 15cm, 30 page full-colour zine (with postcard collages front and back, including typed Dear you narrative) with white cover card and red spine, and a cardboard back. This zine includes ten recent postcard collages from 2011. 1978 (exact date unknown) Dear you, If one didnt mind the parts that were still drying, Canalettos Venezia proved not only to be an adequate and secure crossing but an ttractive one too. Mind how you land, of course, those buildings they can topple and slide into the watery pool below, and the inhabitants take none too kindly to that. They like their painted world to stay relatively fixed a notion I have never shared. Yours with a soaring leap, X (Imaginary trouble is the real thing after all!) All zines are wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth zine to your door. Zine proportions: 10.5cm X 15cm. name: Zine - But I just got here a minute ago (II)
description: But I just got here a minute ago (vol II), a zine by Gracia Haby. A 10.5cm X 15cm, 27 page full-colour zine (with postcard collages front and back, including typed Dear you narrative) with white cover card and yellow spine, and a cardboard back. This zine includes nine recent postcard collages from 2011. Dear you, Labouring under the misapprehension that Swedes were a tall people and built their buildings thusly, I made my way to Stockholms Blue Hall. Seems along with sketchy details of Malayan tapir that I have been mislead once more. City Hall positively diminutive. That said, council spread was generous to a fault and I dined like a mayor of the people. Yours in cramped nourishment, X All zines are wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth zine to your door. Zine proportions: 10.5cm X 15cm. name: Zine - But I just got here a minute ago (III)
description: But I just got here a minute ago (vol III), a zine by Gracia Haby. A 10.5cm X 15cm, 27 page full-colour zine (with postcard collages front and back, including typed Dear you narrative) with white cover card and blue spine, and a cardboard back. This zine includes nine recent postcard collages from 2011. August 12th, 1949 Dear you, Missing you terribly. Missing you more, perhaps, than youll ever know. By day I keep myself busyI admire the sights that are both grand and quiet, and I keep a steady focus, not dwelling on what might have been (no matter how delicious). The nights are harder to tame, and my slumber light. Yours in crumpled sheets tied up with longing, X All zines are wrapped in an envelope with cardboard insert to ensure arrival of a smooth zine to your door. Zine proportions: 10.5cm X 15cm.
